column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=3. Discussion
#Text=Kounis syndrome is defined as acute coronary syndromes ( ACS ) induced by hypersensitivity and anaphylactic reaction .
#Text=Several causes are reported to induce Kounis syndrome , such as medicines , environmental exposures , bee stings , and asthma ( Table 2 ) .
#Text=Ayhan Akoz et al. conducted a prospective study and found the incidence of Kounis syndrome in all admissions to be 19.4/100,000 .
#Text=The most common etiology reported was the use of medications , accounting for about 81 % .
#Text=In the current concept , three variants of Kounis syndrome have been described .
#Text=Type I variant is characterized by allergy-related coronary spasm without coronary lesions or risk factors .
#Text=Patients with type I Kounis syndrome present electrocardiographic change with or without cardiac enzymes elevation due to the acute release of inflammatory mediators inducing coronary spasm .
#Text=The type II variant includes pre-existing atheromatous disease .
#Text=An acute allergic reaction leading to the release of inflammatory mediators induces plaque erosion or rupture , which causes acute myocardial infarction .
#Text=Type III has been defined in patients with pre-existing coronary disease and coronary artery stent thrombosis .

#Text=In the Jack P. Chen et al. study , the pathology of drug-eluting stent ( DES ) thrombosis in these patients presented with eosinophils and mast cell infiltration in Giemsa and hematoxylin – eosin staining .
#Text=In the Stéphane Cook et al. study , the association with late DES thrombosis and local inflammation in histopathology was reported .
#Text=In intravascular ultrasound analysis , vessel remodeling was also confirmed .
#Text=Very late stent thrombosis is recognized as a feature of Kounis syndrome (
#Text=Figure 5
#Text=) .
#Text=The detail pathophysiological mechanisms remain elusive .
#Text=In the current concept , Kounis syndrome is related to inflammatory cell and mast cell-associated disorders .
#Text=Local inflammatory cell interactions induce hypersensitivity and anaphylactic results by releasing inflammatory mediators after activation .
#Text=In the Nicholas G. Kounis et al. summary , Kounis syndrome is a complex multisystem disease accompanied by allergy – hypersensitivity – anaphylaxis .

#Text=During hypersensitivity , the mast cells and lymphocytes release inflammatory mediators , promoting an allergic reaction via a high serum level of histamine , proteases , arachidonic acid products , and chemokines .
#Text=These factors cause platelet aggregating and tissue factor expression .
#Text=The proteases also induce plaque erosion and rupture by activating matrix metalloproteinase ( MMP ) .
#Text=The downstream mediators induce vasoconstriction and worsen coronary vasospasm .
#Text=The diagnosis of Kounis syndrome is based on clinical symptoms and cardiac surveys , including cardiac enzyme , electrocardiographic , echocardiographic , and angiography .
#Text=The serum level of tryptase and histamine can provide more information about the allergic reaction (
#Text=Figure 5
#Text=) .
#Text=Tajda Keber et al.
#Text=suggested measuring cardiac enzymes in acute allergic reaction patients as necessary to diagnose Kounis syndrome promptly and manage cardiac injury early and appropriately .

#Text=Echocardiography and coronary angiography can provide detailed information to rule out takotsubo cardiomyopathy or other cardiac disorders in cardiac wall motion abnormalities patients . Keita Goto et al. reported that thallium-201 ( Tl ) single-photon emission CT ( SPECT ) and 125I-15-(p-iodophenyl)-3-(R , S)-methylpentadecanoic acid ( BMIPP ) SPECT were conducted in a post-Kounis syndrome patient , and they revealed a local perfusion defect with decreased BMIPP uptake .
#Text=Aylin Okur et al. included 26 patients with known or suspected Kounis syndrome and conducted contrast-enhanced magnetic resonance imaging .
#Text=The results revealed an early-phase subendocardial contrast defect and local edema in lesion areas in T2-weighted images .
#Text=These newer images provide a reliable study to assess cardiac injury in Kounis syndrome .
#Text=Compared to the majority of ACS subjects , the therapeutic strategy of Kounis syndrome should focus on both the cardiac injury and allergic reaction .
#Text=Sometimes , the two different conditions may require opposing treatments .
#Text=In the current concept , the administration of medicine should avoid promoting an allergy reaction and aggravating the cardiac injury .
#Text=Intravenous corticosteroids ( hydrocortisone : 1 – 2 mg/kg/day ) and antihistamine agents ( diphenhydramine : 1 – 2 mg/kg ) are useful to control the allergic reaction .
#Text=Aspirin is , however , potentially detrimental because of cyclooxygenase inhibition , promoting arachidonic acid release into the leukotriene pathway .
#Text=Calcium channel blockers and nitrates can relieve the vasospasm .
#Text=In hemodynamically unstable patients , nitrates may not be appropriate due to their hypotension properties .
#Text=Opioids may induce mast cell degeneration , which may worsen the anaphylaxis .
#Text=Beta-blockers should be used with extreme caution because they can exaggerate coronary spasms and cause epinephrine to be ineffective .
#Text=Epinephrine is the only life-saving drug in the event of aggravated ischemia , vasospasm , and arrhythmias .
#Text=In some animal studies , adrenaline may cause LV impairment and not recovery in established anaphylactic shock .
#Text=Therefore , adrenaline is only suggested in high-grade anaphylactic reactions .
#Text=Adequate fluids resuscitation and oxygen therapy are important supportive treatments for Kounis syndrome .
#Text=Type II variant patients can take advantage of an ACS protocol .
#Text=Double antiplatelet therapy in the pharmacological treatment of myocardial revascularization is suggested , including acetylsalicylic acid ( ASA ) and another P2Y12 receptor inhibitor .
#Text=In the type III variant , the ACS protocol accompanied by urgent aspiration of intrastent thrombus is suggested (
#Text=Figure 5
#Text=) .
#Text=Antihistamines , corticosteroids , and mast cell stabilizers may be helpful for allergic symptoms after stent implantation or revascularization .
